result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary A Peckman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to serve 3 days jail consecutive to the 1 year sentence, concurrent to any other sentence.  Time served.

Straight time.  Sentence credit for 119 days granted.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence being served.

Defendant Gary A Peckman in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following Sentence:

1 year jail concurrent to any other sentence being served.  (119 days credit)
Costs: $278.00 (Defendant to serve 3 days jail consecutive to the 1 year sentence, concurrent to any other sentence.)  
DNA Sample previously done, not ordered in this case.
